thread.title: Super Bowl 2017: Celebrities React to Patriots' OT Comeback Win
thread.title_full: Super Bowl 2017: Celebrities React to Patriots' OT Comeback Win

author: Billboard Staff
title: Super Bowl 2017: Celebrities React to Patriots' OT Comeback Win
text: — Lin-Manuel Miranda (@Lin_Manuel) February 6, 2017 Grateful to be here with everyone. #SuperBowl pic.twitter.com/GSUSOiLaXo — Luke Bryan (@LukeBryanOnline) February 5, 2017 Nothing better than Super Bowl Sunday! — THE CHAINSMOKERS (@TheChainsmokers) February 5, 2017 JULIO!!! — Bruno Mars (@BrunoMars) February 6, 2017 Can you put the ball under your shirt or into your pants — christine teigen (@chrissyteigen) February 6, 2017 At the rate we're going, by the end of the #SuperBowl there's gonna be an ad that's just 30 seconds of Yoko Ono shrieking into the void. — The Black Madonna (@blackmadonnachi) February 5, 2017 Watching the Super Bowl in London and they don't have ads. They just cut to a room of guys in suits talking about football — LOVE IS ALIVE (@LouisTheChild) February 6, 2017 Didn't expect a blowout — RUN UP (@diplo) February 6, 2017 This is for you, Monsters. I love you. pic.twitter.com/1Wh56OThzm — xoxo, Joanne (@ladygaga) February 6, 2017 I'm one of 100 million #SuperBowl fans that just went #Gaga for the Lady, & her message to all of us. https://t.co/8AoNqjwr1b — Hillary Clinton (@HillaryClinton) February 6, 2017 Incredible performance from my friend @LadyGaga . You amaze me — and not just onstage. Proud to work with you to end sexual assault. #ItsOnUs pic.twitter.com/ZOva2lpAOZ — Joe Biden (@JoeBiden) February 6, 2017 I want jumping gifs stat! Bravo @ladygaga ---- — KATY PERRY (@katyperry) February 6, 2017 Yeaaaahh get it @ladygaga
